result.execSummary:
The defendant Lavincent Dedward Moore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Lavincent Dedward Moore is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges. On one or more other charges, Lavincent Dedward Moore was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Lavincent Dedward Moore is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Lavincent Dedward Moore was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Lavincent Dedward Moore was found guilty of Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

received and filed.
Supplemental Finding on Defendant's Motion to Stay Execution, signed and filed

Defendant Lavincent Dedward Moore in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Defendant Lavincent Dedward Moore in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for motion to stay sentence pending appeal hearing. Statements heard. Court denies Defense motion. Appeal rights given.

Defendant Lavincent Dedward Moore in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
AS TO COUNTS 5 & 7:
Sentencing hearing proceeded with statements from state, defense and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 5:
The Court ordered the Defendant to:
- Serve 100 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to COUNT 7, STRAIGHT TIME with GOOD TIME, with credit for 40 days time served, FORTHWITH. Court is opposed to EMS.

AS TO COUNT 7:
The Court ordered the Defendant to:
- Serve 30 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to COUNT 5, with credit for 30 days time served.

Court set restitution at zero.
Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharges.

All costs, surcharges and assessment  (including the DNA surcharges) to be paid by 06/26/2023 to convert to a civil judgment.

Appeal rights given.

Defense Notice of Intent to Pursue Postconviction Relief and Motion to Stay Sentence Pending Appeal filed. Arguments heard as to defense motion to stay sentence. Motion to stay sentence pending the appeal motion was denied by the Court.
Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 37.  Motion hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defense, received and filed.
records.descr: Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Motion to Stay Sentence Pending Appeal, received and filed.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit, received and filed.

Jury Trial exhibits from 5/17/22 inventoried on this date.
Location: BOX 780
Exhibit list filed.

Defendant Lavincent Dedward Moore in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   At the hour of 10:03 am the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in  verdicts of,
As to Count 5:  GUILTY
As to Count 6:  NOT GUILTY
As to Count 7:  GUILTY
As to Count 8:  NOT GUILTY
which were then read.  
Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdicts received and filed. 
Jury dismissed.
Court granted state's  motion for judgment on the verdicts on Counts 5 & 7.
Court denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict as to Count 7.
Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction as to Counts 5 & 7. Court ordered entry of judgment of acquittal on Counts 6 & 8.
Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 37.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Lavincent Dedward Moore in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury in jury room at 8:30 am to begin deliberations.
Court addressed jury question on the record with parties. Statements heard.  Court's response to jury.

Defendant Lavincent Dedward Moore in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Trial proceeded outside the presence of the jury. Court continues discussions regarding the authenticity of the 911 call. Milwaukee Police Offer (MPO) Hunter Tuchel on the witness stand. Parties voir dired MPO Tuchel. Court placed findings on the record and allows 911 call to be presented to the jury. Jury in box at 1:59 pm. Testimony of MPO Tuchel continued. Exhibit 10 received. Sworn for the state: MPO Jason Daering. Exhibits 5, 6, 7, 8 and 9 received. Jury left the box at 2:20 pm. Trial proceeded outside the presence of the jury.  State rests subject to rebuttal. Defense motion to dismiss at close of evidence argued. On motion of the defense, Court grants motion to dismiss as to Counts 1 and 2. Defense motion to dismiss as to counts 5, 6, 7 and 8 denied by the Court. Court holds colloquy with defendant regarding his right to testify or not to testify. Court find defendant knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waives his right to testify. Jury in the box 3:20 pm. Defense rests. State and defense rest. Testimony closed. Court instructed jury. Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released. Jury list filed. 
Jury retired at the hour of 4:01 pm to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputy D Rutter who was duly sworn for that purpose. Strikes for cause and sidebar discussions placed on the record. Jury back in box at 4:54. Jury released for the day and instructed to return at 8:30 am on 5/18/2022 in Room 515 of the courthouse.

Defendant Lavincent Dedward Moore in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Outside the precense of the Jury, court addressed preliminary matters. Jury in court at the hour of 9:38 am. Jury sworn. Jury list filed. Court instructed jury. Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded. Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer (MPO) Roy Caul. Sidebars held. Exhibit 1 received. Sidebar held. Exhibits 2, 3 and 4 received. Jury break at 11:00 am. 
Jury back in box at 11:12 am. Testimony of MPO Roy Caul continued. Sworn for the state: MPO Hunter Tuchel. Exhibits 5, 6, 7, 8 and 9 published. Jury recessed for lunch at 11:36 am. Outside the precense of the Jury, court addressed the authentication of 911 call. Parties recessed for lunch.

Defendant Lavincent Dedward Moore in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury panel in court and sworn for questioning.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of 3:15 pm. During jury selection, court provided preliminary jury instructions to the panel. Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impaneled. Jury instructed to return at 9:00 am on 5/17/22. Parties recessed for the day.

Defendant Lavincent Dedward Moore in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case recalled.  This case will be proceeding to jury trial in Branch 37.

Defendant Lavincent Dedward Moore in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Second call on today's scheduled jury trial.  Parties are ready to proceed.
State's motion to admit 911 call heard.  Court placed findings on the record and order the 911 call is admitted into evidence.
On motion of the state for reasons stated on the record, court dismissed COUNTS 3 & 4.
Defense counsel waived reading of the Amended Complaint and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.

Defendant Lavincent Dedward Moore in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  State's motion to amend the criminal complaint heard.  Defense objects as stated on the record.  Court placed findings on the record and finds good cause for the amended criminal complaint.

Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court, defendant Lavincent Dedward Moore not in court, in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court, defendant Lavincent Dedward Moore not in court, in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for . Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for LEVEL 5 SUPERVISION.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Sierre L.   Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Lavincent Dedward Moore in court with attorney Jade K Hall.  Defendant Lavincent Dedward Moore in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
CASE HELD VIA ZOOM AND LIVE STREAM ON DA CAST.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.
